name: Email Account Compromise – Qualification
description:
# 📧 Email Account Compromise – Qualification
---
## 🎯 Usage
Confirm the compromise and:  
- **Delimit** the perimeter (delegations, rules, third-party applications)  
- Estimate the impact  
- Decide on actions to be taken  
---
## ⚙️ Prerequisites
- 🔐**Required personnel**: IT access (administration, monitoring, security equipment), knowledge of business priorities, emergency contact directory.  
  - 👥Internal or external resources, outsourcing provider available if needed.  
- 📝**Actions already undertaken**: list past interventions and document them in the TheHive incident.  
---
## 📌 Objectives
1. Identify the suspected account  
2. Confirm the alert  
3. Assess the incident perimeter  
4. Measure the incident impact
5. Assess the urgency to resolve the incident  
---
## 📄 Resource
👉 [Complete reflex sheet – PDF](https://www.intercert-france.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/fichereflexe-compromissionmessagerie-qualification.pdf)

tasks.title: Measure 4 - Assess the incident impact
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
Qualify the **severity** of the incident.
### 📌 Actions
- Could data have been exfiltrated? Critical data?
- Could the compromise have led to other access?
- Essential activities disrupted? Critical chains?
- Assess regulatory impacts in relation to potentially sensitive data.
### ✅ Deliverables
+ Impact established and documented in the TheHive incident

tasks.title: Measure 1 - Identify the suspected account
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
Precisely frame **who** is impacted.
### 📌 Actions
- Origin of the alert (suspicious sending/receiving, alerts, credential leak)
- Verify account **ownership**, validity, and existing **right delegations**
### ✅ Deliverables
+ Targeted account identified
+ Add the account as an observable in the incident

tasks.title: Measure 2 - Confirm the alert
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
Validate the **incident** or qualify as a false positive.
### 📌 Actions
- Abnormal emails (sending/outbox/trash), (reception) indicating unsolicited password resets or trusted device resets
- Account management verification
  → Illegitimate mailbox rules (forwarding, automatic deletion/reading)
  → Have suspicious permission changes been observed?
- Third-party application verification
- **Unusual connections** verification
  → Successful connections from unusual locations or systems?
  → Successful connections at unusual times?
### ✅ Deliverables
+ Qualification conclusion
+ Document relevant information in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 3 - Assess the incident perimeter
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
Understand the **scope**.
### 📌 Actions
- Identify the type of affected account
  → Standard user account?
  → Sensitive user account?
  → Administrative account?
  → Functional account?
- Identify potential access of the compromised account outside of messaging
  → VPN, File sharing, Remote access, Cloud service, Extranet, Various applications
- Probable vector (phishing, bruteforce, infostealer)
- Identify antiviral detections
- Identify equipment theft
### ✅ Deliverables
+ Estimated perimeter documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 5 - Assess the urgency to resolve the incident
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
Assess the urgency to resolve the incident by crossing:  
- Business urgency on vital activities  
- Recency and nature of detected signals  
- Risk of generalization
### 📌 Actions
- For each of the impacted vital activities identified previously:
  → Is there a business continuity procedure in nominal mode?
  → Is there an activity maintenance procedure in degraded mode?
- Observed activity: recent, recurrent or already observed in the past?  
### ✅ Deliverables
- Continuity or activity maintenance analysis  
- Qualified detection history (recent, recurrent, old)  
- Documented conclusion on urgency level in the **activities** of this task
